item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
sheridanm962:

I’m never going to buy a Call of Dookie game. It’s overpriced for years (seen MW2 go for $80 around 2011), and the fan base are nothing but 6 year old’s in disguise playing with toys.

Holy crap, thank you for opening my eyes kind stranger. I will never forget this. I’m also loling2themax at that pun you made :lol: .

item.source: Call of Duty: Black Ops II

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops II
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
The new renderer was coded in DX11 but since DX11 is backwards compatible, it can run on DX9 cards. However, XP doesn’t support anything beyond DX9, so that’s why they had to drop support.

Besides, XP is 11 years old. At some point support for it has to drop.

Read full topic
item.source: Call of Duty: Black Ops II

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops II
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
https://www.vg247.com/2012/09/03/call-of-duty-black-ops-2-minimum-pc-specs-revealed-xp-users-out-of-luck/

Okay, I’m going to need some explanation on this. It says in the article in a quote that they’ve abandoned DX9 for DX11 (thus abandoning XP) but the minimum requirements is an 8800GT, which I’m sure is not a DX11 (or even DX10) card.

That being said, I’m thinking of picking this up just to show that I support what they’re doing. The game is already going to sell like hotcakes but still. It surprises me that CoD of all things is one of the few games that has dropped DX9 support (at least Treyarch’s game), which should start becoming more common.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops II
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
It’s as if the first Crysis was a mere coincidence manifested upon throwing a shit ton of ideas, stuffed into a garbage can, at a wall.

And they’ve been trying to recreate it but have failed miserably.

Or they’ve fallen into the black hole that is linear FPS and can’t seem to escape, no matter how hard they try.

Read full topic
item.source: Call of Duty: Black Ops II

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops II
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
The game was laughable. The best part was when they attempted to make the game non-linear by giving two blatantly marked options “Snipe” or “Repel” when the two options were just different tactics for a single battle in a single area, not a choice between separate paths. At least they’re trying, but they’re just failing even worse in the process.

Read full topic

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops II
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
So they had a demo of this game at Microsoft’s press conference. It looks terrible. I saw a lot of blurry textures even at the 600p that they’re running at. And the gameplay is same old same old. I was getting a little bit interested in this game but that demo destroyed whatever interest I had.

Read full topic
item.source: Call of Duty: Black Ops II

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops II
item.dc:creator: amazingcomedy
item.description:
Kairouseki:

But you added HL in there too which, besides a few puzzles sprinkled here and there, is pretty much running and gunning. I never got the fascination with Deus Ex either. Maybe you had to play it when it was released.

Meh, I guess I worded it wrong. Take a look at gameplay of SS2, DX, or HL, then look at gameplay of COD. See the difference? There’s alot more actual thinking and problem solving in the three formers then there are in the latter. While HL was run n’ gun as well in certain aspects, you have to remember that this can apply for all of the four games I’ve mentioned.
The difference is, COD for the most part is just see something = shoot it.
DX, HL, and SS2 interupted shooting with jumping puzzles, turning the power for something on, finding a whole new way around an obstacle through unconventional means, gain access to a room full of vital info via keycode, and this kind of stuff.
Now this doesn’t mean I hate COD, it’s pretty good, especially to have a large fanbase, but it’s just not my thing.

Read full topic
item.source: Call of Duty: Black Ops II

item.source: Call of Duty: Black Ops II

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops II
item.dc:creator: amazingcomedy
item.description:
What I meant by casual was that COD is pretty much a simple run n’ gun game. A game like Deus Ex for example isn’t just about shooting, it’s also about finding keypad codes, looking for hidden areas, press buttons to make shit happen, etc. That sort of thing doesn’t happen very much in COD, at least not any of the ones I’ve played.

Read full topic
